DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date of an exam using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT), which combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An exam using Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT), which combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.  OCT uses infrared light waves that reflect off the internal microstructure within the biological tissues. The frequencies and bandwidths of infrared light are orders of magnitude higher than medical ultrasound signals, resulting in greatly increased image resolution, 8-25 times greater than any existing modality. In addition to providing high-level resolutions for the evaluation of microanatomic structures OCT is also able to provide information regarding tissue composition.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) combines the principles of ultrasound with the imaging performance of a microscope.  OCT uses infrared light waves that reflect off the internal microstructure within the biological tissues. The frequencies and bandwidths of infrared light are orders of magnitude higher than medical ultrasound signals, resulting in greatly increased image resolution, 8-25 times greater than any existing modality. ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
